metadata.title: grub2: heap-based buffer overflow (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: The CVE program describes this issue as: GNU GRUB (aka GRUB2) through 2.12 has a heap-based buffer overflow in fs/hfs.c via crafted sblock data in an HFS filesystem. 
            STATEMENT: To exploit this flaw, an attacker needs to trick a user into running grub2 with a specially crafted HFS file system image, limiting the exposure of this flaw. For this reason, this vulnerability has been rated with a moderate severity.
            MITIGATION: Do not run grub2 in an untrusted environment, specially with a HFS file system image.
